Description: Rim fragment of pottery dinos of the 'London Dinos group'; interior glazed; guilloche on the rim, and outlined tongues in red and lack on the shoulder. Decoration below obscured by modern label. Clay reddish-brown, micaceous.
Producer name: Attributed to: The London Dinos Group
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
marked "19" and "58" in pencil on inside.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 220, no. 77)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 102, pl. XXX, no. 307.2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GK.14)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4698 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
